TF035751-KAZAKSTAN - PUBLIC SECTOR
            RESOURCE MANAGEMENT,TF033556-KAZAKHSTAN - STRUCTURAL ADJUSTMENT,TF032715-KAZAKHSTAN - SECOND STRUCTURAL
            ADJUSTMENT LOAN

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the project was
            satisfactory, and sustainability is likely, with substantial
            institutional development impact. Lessons drawn from the
            project address primarily, the importance of realistic
            reform targets, even if they are ambitious, for they provide
            the stimulus for government reform support, commitment, and
            wider participation in structural adjustment lending.
            Likewise, appropriate counterpart in terms of scope, and
            level of authority, is particularly important, since it
            provides the highest, and continuous political support. But
            reform program actions should be based on execution, with
            specific control by local authorities, to provide the
            benefit of timely budgeted allowances. Furthermore,
            extensive, and specialized technical assistance (TA) is
            necessary to implement institutional reforms, because not
            only, changes in systems, and processes are required, but
            because reforms are difficult to implement, complex, and
            time-consuming, and, most importantly, TA provides the
            professional skills required in a changing environment. This
            cannot be achieved without responsive donor partners, whose
            assistance, and effectiveness proved critical in the
            provision of a timely, and high-quality TA.
